snippet: Census figures suggest that in 2020, Rhode Island may be down to a single seat in Congress because its population is declining. The state now has two House seats.
abstract: Further evidence emerges that Rhode Island will lose one of its two House seats following the 2020 Census due to declining population.
lead_paragraph: Census figures suggest that in 2020, Rhode Island may be down to a single seat in Congress because its population is declining. The state now has two House seats.

headline.seo: Shrinking Rhode Island Likely to Lose House Seat
headline.main: Rhode Island Likely to Lose a House Seat
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island Likely to Lose a House Seat
